referrals.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

history.action: Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on General, Housing, and Military Affairs
Referred to Committee on Ways and Means per Rule 35(a)
Referred to Committee on Appropriations per Rule 35(a)
Read Second Time
Rep. Stevens of Waterbury reported for the committee on General, Housing, and Military Affairs
Rep. Scheu of Middlebury recommended for the committee on Ways and Means
Rep. Hooper of Montpelier recommended for the committee on Appropriations
Report of Committee on General, Housing, and Military Affairs substituted by Report of Committee on Ways and Means
Report of Committee on Ways and Means amended as offered by Committee on Appropriations
Rep. Browning of Arlington and Sullivan of Dorset moved to substitute an amendment
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 72 of 142 to Pass -- Yeas = 55, Nays = 87
Which was disagreed to
Report of Committee on Ways and Means as amended agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 73 of 144 to Pass -- Yeas = 92, Nays = 52
Third Reading Ordered
Rep. Murphy of Fairfax moved to amend the bill
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Ralph of Hartland moved to amend the bill
Rep. Ralph of Hartland asked and was granted leave to withdraw amendment
Read Third time
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 73 of 144 to Pass -- Yeas = 92, Nays = 52
Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Rules
Referred to Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs per Temporary Senate Rule 44A
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with recommendation of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Referred to Committee on Finance per Senate Rule 31
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Cummings
Rules suspended & bill committed to Committee on Appropriations with the report of Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs & Finance intact, on motion of Senator Cummings
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
Reported without recommendation by Committee on Appropriations
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
Reported without recommendation by Committee on Appropriations
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Sirotkin for Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Reported favorably by Senator Sirotkin for Committee on Finance with proposal of amendment
Reported without recommendation by Senator Kitchel for Committee on Appropriations
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs amended as recommended by Committee on Finance
Proposal of amendment  by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs, as amended, agreed to
3rd reading ordered on roll call, requested by Senator Benning, Passed -- Needed 15 of 29 to Pass -- Yeas = 19, Nays = 10
New Business/Third Reading
Unfinished Business/Third Reading

Unfinished Business/Third Reading
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Sirotkin, Balint, and Clarkson motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Mazza
Senate Message, adopted in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Action Postponed to next legislative day as moved by Rep. Stevens of Waterbury
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Stevens of Waterbury
Speaker appointed Stevens of Waterbury, Scheu of Middlebury and Gonzalez of Winooski as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
House message House refused to concur in Senate proposal of amendment & requested Conference Committee; House Conference Committee members appointed
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators Sirotkin, Clarkson, and Balint
Entered on Notice Calendar
Committee of Conference Report
Committee of Conference Report
Committee of Conference report; text
Committee of Conference report adopted on roll call, requested by Senator Sirotkin, Passed -- Needed 15 of 29 to Pass -- Yeas = 20, Nays = 9
Senate message, report of committee of conference adopted
Committee of Conference report adopted (House bill)
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 89, Nays = 58
House message House adopted Conference Committee report
Delivered to the Governor on January 27, 2020
Vetoed by the Governor on January 31,2020
Veto of the Governor sustained, by a vote of Yeas = 99, Nays = 51
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 101 of 150 to Pass -- Yeas = 99, Nays = 51
House message: Governor vetoed bill on January 31, 2020
Governor vetoed bill; text of veto message
